extendedIngredients.name: fish fillets
extendedIngredients.original: Saute the fish fillets skin side down with olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Press a couple times with a spatula, flip and remove from the heat.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Saute the fish fillets skin side down with olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Press a couple times with a spatula, flip and remove from the heat
meta: with olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. press a couple times with a spatula, flip and remove from the heat.

extendedIngredients.name: toast bread
extendedIngredients.original: Toast the bread, and spread the rillettes on top.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Toast the bread, and spread the rillettes on top

extendedIngredients.name: tofu skin
extendedIngredients.original: Discard the skin, and transfer the flesh to a bowl. Add the butter, season with smoked salt and piment d'espelette to taste, and mix with a fork.
extendedIngredients.originalName: Discard the skin, and transfer the flesh to a bowl. Add the butter, season with smoked salt and piment d'espelette to taste, and mix with a fork

extendedIngredients.name: trout fillets
extendedIngredients.original: 4 oz small trout fillets, skin on

title: Ice Fishing, And Quick Seared Trout With Smoked Trout Rillettes
summary: Ice Fishing, And Quick Seared Trout With Smoked Trout Rillettes requires approximately 45 minutes from start to finish. For $14.44 per serving, this recipe covers 59% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains around 124g of protein, 93g of fat, and a total of 1493 calories. This recipe serves 4. This recipe from Food Perestroika has 1 fans. It works well as a pricey main course. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. A mixture of trout fillets, pepper, olive oil, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. To use up the salt you could follow this main course with the Apple Turnovers Recipe as a dessert. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 83%, which is amazing. If you like this recipe, you might also like recipes such as Smoked Trout Rillettes, Beehive Smoked-Trout Rillettes, and Pan-Seared Tarragon Trout.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: GIFFT Pinot Grigio bursts with lively pear and tropical fruits, balanced by crisp acidity and an elegantly refined freshness. Featuring ripe stone fruit and citrus aromas, this wine showcases melon, nectarine and Meyer lemon flavors that finish light and refreshing.
